narrative.description:
# 🌐 Website Lead Capture and Routing Process

## 📋 Process Overview
> This process manages the capture, scoring, and routing of leads from website contact form submissions to appropriate regional sales teams.

## 🔄 Process Steps
1. 📝 Contact form submission capture
2. 🎯 Automated lead scoring based on organization type
3. 🌍 Regional sales team assignment
4. ⏱️ Initial response tracking with SLA

## 📥 Required Inputs
- Contact form data:
  • 🏢 Organization name
  • 🏛️ Organization type (embassy/government/corporate)
  • 👤 Contact person details
  • 📍 Geographic location
  • 💬 Inquiry details

## 🔧 Process Variables
• 📊 leadScore: Integer (0-100)
• 🏛️ organizationType: String
• 🌎 assignedRegion: String
• 👥 assignedTeam: String
• ⏰ slaDeadline: DateTime

## ↔️ Inter-step Data Flow
1. 📋 Form submission → Lead scoring:
   • Organization type determines initial score
   • Contact details validate completeness
2. 📈 Lead scoring → Team assignment:
   • Score and location determine regional team
3. 👥 Team assignment → SLA tracking:
   • Team availability affects response time requirements

## 📊 Process Mining Insights

### 💎 Business Value
• ⚡ Reduces lead response time by 60%
• 🎯 Improves lead qualification accuracy
• 🌐 Ensures compliance with regional sales territories
• 🤝 Maintains consistent customer experience

### 🔄 Implementation Rationale
1. Previous manual routing caused:
   • ⏰ 40% of leads received delayed responses
   • 🚫 25% territory assignment errors
   • ❌ Inconsistent lead qualification
2. Automated process ensures:
   • ✅ Standardized scoring
   • 🎯 Accurate territory management
   • ⏱️ SLA compliance

## 📈 Available Reports
1. ⏱️ Response Time Analytics
   • Average response time per region
   • SLA compliance rate
   • Peak submission times

2. 📊 Lead Quality Metrics
   • Score distribution by organization type
   • Conversion rates by score range
   • Regional performance comparison

3. ⚙️ Operational Efficiency
   • Team workload distribution
   • Territory balance analysis
   • Process bottleneck identification
